title: Transitional Kindergarten
subject: Transitional Kindergarten California Common Core Standards (CCCS)

document.title: Transitional Kindergarten California Common Core Standards (CCCS)

5706A376C6204F4DB40CF51E52822A96.description: Analyze, compare, create, and compose shapes.

35C97B61E972460FBC402F1E70C1BEE6.description:
Describe the relative positions of these objects using terms such as above, below, beside, in front of, behind, and
next to.

A74A15BCDA834D429EDA7E00771E466B.description: Describe objects in the environment using names of shapes.

33F08962794B4B0899D45942E3326C41.description: Geometry: Identify and describe shapes (squares, circles, triangles, rectangles, hexagons).

459025795F0941E8A3B57EB394AD5F1B.description:
Classify objects into given categories; count the numbers of objects in each category and sort the categories
by count.

FA4A23853DA0494487A8F55CD127CAD9.description:
Directly compare two objects with a measurable attribute in common, to see which object has “more of / less
of” the attribute, and describe the difference. For example, directly compare the heights of two children and
describe one child as taller / shorter.

99AC978F81A946A6BD3F39C681137869.description: Describe measurable attributes of objects, such as length or weight.

6F5D903EDCF6426CA575B665B3882CCF.description: Decompose numbers into pairs in more than one way.

C428E7BE1015459CBA9185749B8DC1DC.description:
Solve addition and subtraction word problems, and add and subtract, e.g., by using objects or drawings to
represent the problem.

93B3F4A098744AE38ECBF18D2338E121.description:
Represent addition and subtraction with objects, fingers, mental images, drawings, sounds, (e.g., claps),
acting out situations, verbal explanations.

4B238FFD1F3440ECB87CA9F15489537F.description: Operations and Algebraic Thinking: Understand addition as putting together and adding to, and understand subtraction as talking apart and taking from.

FB443997121747D88F40C458971B9139.description:
Compare numbers. Identify whether the number of objects in one group is greater than, less than, or equal
to the number of objects in another group, e.g., by using matching and counting strategies.

6A3C727B22574F78BAC4535A18A739B6.description:
Count to answer “how many?” questions about things arranged in a line, a rectangle array, or a circle, things
in a scattered configuration; given a number count out that many objects.

EF2C9FBBB12D42AAAFE2A8E55D5967CE.description: Understand that each successive number name refers to a quantity that is one larger.

0A4074617CF84EAEA867F7C53571233B.description:
Understand that the last number name said tells the number of objects counted. The number of objects is the
same regardless of their arrangement or the order in which they were counted.

2BC5F08683B64E53B35E74BC84D12CBD.description:
When counting objects, say the number names in the standard order, pairing each object with one and only one
number name and each number name with one and only one object.

AA5EE6CF5E8F4CF5B2F62270F72CEC90.description:
Count to tell the number of objects. Understand the relationship between numbers and quantities; connect
counting to cardinality.

CD6C20F4574E4A009AFDB1C7647C0F30.description: Write numbers from 0 – 20 (with 0 representing a count of no objects).

E0320180059E412699F196C5F5E635AA.description: Count forward beginning from a given number within the known sequence (instead of having to begin at 1).

3BB5D061F9DA449B980B0C8935FAC449.description: Know number names and the count sequence.

6D8B9D1FA5894DB19E75C5BE6C63FBB4.description:
Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to narrate a single event or several loosely linked
events.

C8C16D339C03477B90A41499E30C7A96.description:
Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to compose informative / explanatory texts in which they
name what they are writing about and supply some information about the topic.

4FB38E0F4F1B4B35BE55C0B08A88E1C8.description:
Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to compose opinion pieces in which they state and
opinion or preference.

25745FC8C95D47A898B9DD6AF98D1EF1.description: Use illustrations and context to make predictions about text.

61BC3B3E499E463D9FF17204CD3E6112.description: Actively engage in group reading activities with purpose and understanding.

F68551D49847452D8FEC03ECE2541CE3.description:
Name the author and illustrator of a text and define the role of each in presenting the ideas or
information in a text.

616BED673BD2421DA68FE7FB719D57BD.description: Identify the front cover, back cover, and title page of a book.

C25D838ED5E1402F8659DD726A9ED175.description: With prompting and support, identify the main topic of a text.

3B61822C34A74764AF57C66D249B6172.description: With prompting and support answer questions about text.

18E30B953048456CAEF28F3999C2A376.description: Use illustrations and context to make predictions about text.

44254A1DE1BC4E459F7F62D11B110B37.description: Activate prior knowledge related to the information and events in texts.

C7B17B3B95BC4294B84D29F2A619CF67.description: Actively engage in group reading activities with purpose and understanding.

2770C39552D24A73A5C34BCCDB0694AD.description: With prompting and support, compare and contrast the characters in familiar stories.

F7093B3A7D61439ABB434FDC2137D800.description:
With prompting and support, describe illustrations and the story in which they appear (e.g., what moment in
a story and illustration depicts).

27245CF0E6F841EAA1815E71EAA1D408.description:
With prompting and support, name the author and illustrator of a story and define the role of each in telling
the story.

BDC3B6C123E64461A28FBFC1997750E2.description: With prompting and support, identify characters, settings, and major events.

6ED5E974A673411C94CEDCE70A9C7DFB.description: With prompting and support, retell familiar stories including key details.

08F2C6FB3DAE4CDFAF816F690F5E0740.description: With prompting and support answer questions about details in a text.

3C8A67B75FC84E7EB5CDF1341BFE96FA.description: Read common high-frequency words by sight. (District determines)

DFEEB7079D144AD8B4FDC8B91C86B267.description: Associate short sounds with common spellings (graphemes) for the five major vowels.

B0015DC1DF9A4119999674AC42EF000A.description:
Demonstrate basic knowledge of one-to-one letter-sound correspondences by producing the primary sounds for
each consonant.

99AA9E110FBD41169903CBB7B66E0933.description:
Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words both in isolation and
in text.

91FC0E1CEF3742DD82125FA0CAA616B1.description:
Isolate and pronounce the initial final sounds (phonemes) in three-phoneme (CVC) words. This does not include
CVC’s ending with /l/, /r/ or /x/).

DB6E370D21C047B199F1DFA616047B79.description: Blend two or three phonemes into recognizable words.

EDD90FD53422465ABD96E7D4EE31D6F0.description: Blend and segment onsets and rimes of single-syllable spoken words.

CFAB26171B754C2ABDD2054E7C8430FB.description: Count, pronounce, blend, and segment syllables in spoken words.

CBC4D238826445BEBE6BE879CE6E1109.description: Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and sounds (phonemes).

79A24E8B30634AC99EFEA1FEA39BA424.description: Recognize and name upper and lower case letters of the alphabet.

2C2B2DB50E7B4DF38005B3553D669EDB.description: Understand that words are separated by spaces in print.

EBBBF094368642BF9A6531ED47A15710.description: Recognize that spoken words are represented in written language by specific sequences of letters.

F0A87F595462418DBC247C995F9293D5.description: Follow words from left to right, top to bottom, and page by page.

88B4F1893DBC45429E19752E7DAF6986.description: Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of print.

36532A35974945DAB494FE5BFE6E17FF.description: Indentify real-life connections between words and their use (e.g., note places at school that are colorful).

5116103DF09D44C2A06E60B8FF3F6B83.description: Demonstrate understanding of frequently occurring adjectives by relating them to their opposites (antonyms).

E434C1E48BC64FF79C3DF6A7051CAF5B.description:
Sort common objects into categories (e.g., shapes, foods) to gain a sense of the concepts the categories
represent.

52ADC357EE894754AF98BD1D3BEEDBC8.description: With guidance and support from adults, explore word relationships and nuances in word meanings.

1308147B87034FF2A13CEA1C74E6C119.description: Use the most frequently occurring inflections and affixes (e.g., -ed, -s).

07856EAB2F9D47FBA24AD24726846E47.description: Indentify new meanings for familiar words.

CFE412418AB947F1B85CD9EBE677F6E6.description:
– Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on
kindergarten reading and content.

2D6CB4E0ACE84FCFB90ABB6EA0027DFD.description: Spell simple words phonetically drawing on knowledge of sound-letter relationships.

17FEE6AE939F4FD4B770DFF7D99ADBCF.description: Write letter or letters for most consonants.

10B4133866AF4D7BA848340FD6896DE9.description: Capitalize the first word in a sentence and the pronoun I.

A9FD16BA18354530A3F9D757ED0DFC91.description:
Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when
writing.

74A45B5B7697460C9CC43FACFC2DDE4D.description: Produce and expand complete sentences in shared language activities.

7FBFE54C55E747E4BB93E76E6EADC83F.description: Use the most frequently occurring prepositions (e.g., to, from, in, out, on, off, for, of, by, with).

95ACC264410A45FB8371503ABBEDC443.description: Understand and use question words (interrogatives) (e.g., who, what, where, when, why, how).

772AAC3CAABB4C41BCEFB806E2258056.description: Form regular plural nouns orally by adding /s/ or /es/ (e.g., dog, dogs; wish, wishes).

A45C1A980E6D4CBBB13B8395C35DF5FF.description: Use frequently occurring nouns and verbs.

009814178CE24F1AA29F9AF206F0D35E.description: Print many uppercase and lowercase letters.

C04241C055224852B1CD9DC28330D407.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when speaking.

384F75AFB1B84CA8B3C20376E6E8E726.description: Speak audibly and express thoughts, feelings, and ideas clearly.

83F8AC741BAC42D7AAE9B3E65F84452E.description: Add drawings or other visual displays to descriptions as desired to provide additional detail.

A0E3F9FF6B184297AD9A5D33B62061BB.description: Describe familiar people, places, things, and events.

EDDB6662ABE14FA9B56F1399297893BB.description:
Ask and answer questions in order to seek help, get information, or clarify something that is not
understood.

3C5FBDAB153B41B98601F9D1D5B30A00.description: Understand and follow one step oral directions.

5EE57297EC9C44E6902B15D1861CEC18.description:
Confirm understanding of a text read aloud or information presented orally or through other media by
answering questions about key details and requesting clarification if something is not understood.

967E4731DEAF42698FA97BEEB076B88A.description:
Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions (e.g. listening to others and taking turns speaking about the topics and
texts under discussion).

635C80E1F082424B803F29823E310871.description:
Participate in collaborative conversations with diverse partners about kindergarten topics and texts with
peers and adults in small and larger groups.
